abstract: Representatives of the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and Libya offer different outlooks about how long it might take Libya to restore its oil production to prewar levels. Issues include oil field security and repairing damaged property.
snippet: An OPEC official predicts a return to prewar levels by the end of 2012, but others are not as optimistic.
lead_paragraph: An OPEC official predicts a return to prewar levels by the end of 2012, but others are not as optimistic.

headline.main: Views Differ on Restoring Libyan Oil Output
headline.print_headline: Views Differ on Restoring Libyan Oil Output
headline.seo: Forecasts Differ on Restoring Libyan Oil Output
